taxes.local_income_tax_range: N/A - California has no local income tax

property_tax_examples.description: Lower rates in less populated areas

taxes.property_assessment_frequency: Annual for value changes, reassessed on sale (Prop 13)
taxes.assessment_appeal_process: File with county assessment appeals board between July 2 and November 30 (or within 60 days of supplemental assessment notice). Hearing scheduled within 2 years.
taxes.tax_incentives: CalSavers (state IRA program), ScholarShare 529 (state-sponsored 529 plan with state tax benefits), Mortgage Credit Certificate program
taxes.tax_structure: Progressive state income tax (1% to 13.3%, highest in nation); sales tax high; property tax limited by Prop 13 to 1% + approved bonds

housing.housing_market_trends: Very high and rising - severe housing shortage, particularly in coastal metros. Inland areas more affordable but still expensive nationally.
housing.first_time_homebuyer_program: CalHFA - California Housing Finance Agency offers MyHome Assistance Program with down payment assistance up to 3.5%

insurance.data_source: California Department of Insurance average rates for $300K home coverage

employment.major_industries: Technology, Entertainment, Agriculture, Tourism, Manufacturing, Healthcare

banking.minor_banking_rules: Minors can open custodial accounts with parent/guardian. At age 18, account automatically converts to individual account.

consumer_protection.consumer_protection_agency: California Attorney General - Consumer Protection Section

local_examples.major_retailers: Target, Walmart, Costco, Trader Joe's, Safeway
local_examples.utility_providers: PG&E, Southern California Edison, SDG&E, SoCalGas
local_examples.healthcare_market: Covered California marketplace; extensive provider networks; high costs but comprehensive coverage options

notes: California has highest state income tax in nation (up to 13.3%) and high cost of living, particularly in coastal areas. Housing crisis is severe with median home prices exceeding $780,000. Proposition 13 (1978) caps property tax increases at 2% annually unless property sold. State minimum wage is $16/hour (2024), highest in nation. Major tech industry presence in Silicon Valley drives high salaries but also high housing costs. Strong consumer protection laws (CCPA privacy law, auto-renewal disclosure requirements). State experiencing population decline for first time, with residents moving to lower-cost states like Texas, Arizona, Nevada.
